author: Brian Turner
method: Place the prawn shells and heads, chilli, tomato and stock into a saucepan. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat until the mixture is simmering and simmer for 4-5 minutes.  Strain the mixture through a sieve, discarding the shells and tomato pieces. Reserve the liquid. Chop the cooked noodles and place them into a soup bowl. Pour over the fish broth. To serve, scatter over the chopped herbs.
ingredients: 4 raw tiger prawns, shells and heads only (reserve the prawns for another dish),  ½ red chilli, chopped,  ½ tomato, chopped,  500ml/18fl oz fish stock,  100g/3½oz fresh egg noodles, cooked according to packet instructions, drained,  1 tbsp chopped fresh parsley,  1 tbsp chopped fresh coriander
